page.title: 08FORT ELSON
page.content: FORT ELSON WAS BUILT IN 1856 AS PART OF THE DEFENCES OF PORTSMOUTH HARBOUR. IT WAS ONE OF THE FIRST POLYGONAL FORTIFICATIONS TO BE BUILT IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND CONSISTS OF A D SHAPED EARTHERN RAMPART TO THE FRONT WITH A DEFENSIBLE BARRACKS TO THE REAR. FORT BROCKHURST WAS BUILT BETWEEN 1858 AND 1862 AT A COST OF Â£108,909. IT IS ONE OF THREE IDENTICAL FORTS IN THE GOMER ELSON LINE. IT WAS BUILT MAINLY FROM LOCAL BRICK AND HAS A CIRCULAR KEEP TO THE REAR WITH AN EARTHERN RAMPART TO THE FRONT. IT IS SURROUNDED BY A WET MOAT AND WAS DESIGNED FOR AN ARMAMENT OF 87 GUNS. THESE FORS HAVE BEEN GIVEN THE NAME "PALMERSTON'S FOLLIES" FORT BROCKHURST IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.
